The bill includes $400 billion in direct payments, $300 weekly extended jobless benefits, and $350 billion in aid for state and local governments. The measure was passed after an all-night session, with Democrats agreeing to reduce jobless benefits to secure passage in the Senate. The bill now heads to the House of Representatives for a vote, with Biden hoping to sign it into law soon.

site_title: New Zealand central bank in no hurry to remove stimulus, RBNZ official says
summary: New Zealand's Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) has stated it is in no hurry to remove economic stimulus and tighten monetary policy, according to Assistant Governor Christian Hawkesby. The RBNZ held interest rates last week and will maintain easy policy settings for a prolonged period. Hawkesby warned that markets may experience "false starts" as they try to get ahead of the central bank's decisions, citing the recent volatility in bond markets. The RBNZ's patient approach aims to remind markets that it is not in a hurry to remove stimulus.

site_title: Huawei executive's extradition fight enters final round in Canada
summary: Chinese Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou faces a final round in a Canadian court to fight extradition to the US, where she's accused of bank fraud and conspiracy over alleged violations of US sanctions against Iran. Meng denies the charges, and her lawyers argue that Canada and the US have denied her a fair process due to alleged abuses. The case has strained Canada-China relations, with two Canadian citizens imprisoned in China. Meng's extradition trial is set to wrap up in mid-May, with her lawyers challenging the US claims and arguing that extraditing her would break international law.

site_title: Singapore stocks pull back at Friday's open; STI down 0.4%
summary: Singapore's Straits Times Index (STI) fell 0.4% to 3,003.72 at open on Friday, following a decline in US equities overnight. Local banks UOB, OCBC, and DBS also dropped, with DBS tumbling 1.3%. Singapore Airlines fell 1% after announcing a data breach from a cyber attack. The decline was attributed to investors' disappointment with Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell's response to inflation fears.

site_title: RBA doubles down in defence of yields amid global bond rebound
summary: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) announced plans to buy double the usual amount of long-dated bonds, worth A$4 billion, in an effort to combat rising yields amid global bond market volatility. This move led to a 32 basis point drop in Australia's 10-year yield to 1.60%, the largest drop in a year. The RBA's actions are seen as a response to the global market's concerns about runaway bets on reflation and a rapid economic recovery, with central banks expected to maintain their loose settings.

site_title: Europe: Stocks rise on economic recovery hopes
summary: European stocks rose on Tuesday due to hopes for an economic recovery, despite mixed trading in New York. The European Union's medicines regulator stated that AstraZeneca's vaccine benefits outweigh potential risks, and several countries suspended its use due to safety concerns. The Federal Reserve's policy meeting this week is expected to maintain its bond-buying scheme and keep interest rates low until 2023. Despite US retail sales and industrial production declines, investors are optimistic about the recovery, with expectations of a surge in activity later this year.

site_title: Malaysia: Shares close lower on Thursday
summary: Malaysia's FTSE Bursa Malaysia Kuala Lumpur Composite Index closed 10.42 points lower at 1,629.41 on Thursday, with 9.530 billion lots traded worth RM5.438 billion. Gainers outnumbered losers 759 to 435.

site_title: Zalora's female leaders make diversity a priority
summary: Zalora's CEO Gunjan Soni and CTO Silvia Thom have made diversity a priority, with women making up 45% of top 50 positions and 55% of the workforce. The company comprises at least 30 nationalities, reflecting its customer base of 75% female customers. Under their leadership, Zalora achieved 21.2% revenue growth and 32.3% gross profit improvement in 2020. They emphasize the importance of diverse talent, empowerment, and authenticity in leadership, citing research by McKinsey & Company that shows companies in the top quartile for gender diversity outperform those in the bottom quartile.

images.alt_text: CEO Gunjan Soni (left) and CTO Silvia Thom's vision of a culture that promotes diversity and transparency is driven by a desire to ensure that the company is representative of its customer base.

site_title: China power giant wants to get ahead on Xi's emissions goals
summary: China's State Grid Corp plans to upgrade its massive electricity grid to reduce coal generation and reach peak carbon emissions by 2030, in line with President Xi Jinping's target. The upgrades, worth $350 billion, will include new transmission lines, pumped hydro storage plants, and electric vehicle charging networks, aiming to increase clean electricity transmission and reduce peak coal consumption. The plan is expected to support China's goal of being net-zero by 2060.

images.alt_text: State Grid Corp of China will build seven ultra-high voltage power lines with transmission capacity of 56 gigawatts.
